Base shiny plot that has ONLY a dropdown menu for cities
```{r}
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("TITLE"),
  sidebarLayout(  
    sidebarPanel(
      #option for selecting teams
      selectInput(
        "city", "City:",
        choices= unique(fig_city$city)
      ),
    ),
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput(outputId = "scatterplot")
    )))

server <- function(input, output) {
  output$scatterplot <- renderPlot({
    ggplot(fig_city[fig_city$city==input$city,], aes(x=attr_index_norm, y=realSum, color=room_type, size=person_capacity), input$day_type == day_type) + 
      geom_point(alpha=0.7) + xlab("X") + ylab("Y") + 
      ggtitle("TITLE") + 
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90, vjust=0.5, hjust=1)) +
      ylim(0, 2000) +
      theme_classic()
  })
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
```

Dropdown box for city, slider for price, checkbox weekend/weekday, radio button for biz, checkbox for color
```{r}
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("TITLE"),
   sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      # Dropdown box for city
    selectInput("city", label = "City:",
              choices= unique(fig_city$city)),
      # Slider range for price
    sliderInput("realSum", label = "Price of Rental", min = 0, 
        max = 1000, value = c(0, 1000)),
      # Checkbox for day of the week
    checkboxGroupInput("dayofweek", label = "Weekday vs. Weekend Rental", 
    choices= unique(fig_city$dayofweek), selected = c("weekday", "weekend")),
      # Radio button for business vs. vacation rentals
    radioButtons("biz", label = "Business vs. Vacation Rental",
    choices = list("Vacation" = 0, "Business" = 1), selected = 1),
      # Checkbox for room type
    checkboxGroupInput("room_type", label = "Rental Room Type", 
    choices= unique(fig_city$room_type), selected = c("Private room", "Entire home/apt", "Shared room"))
    ),
  mainPanel(
     plotOutput("scatterplot")
    )
  ))

server <- function(input, output){
  
   output$scatterplot <- renderPlot({
     
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(dayofweek %in% input$dayofweek)
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(biz %in% input$biz)
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(room_type %in% input$room_type)
     
     ggplot(fig_city[fig_city$city==input$city,], aes(x=dist, y=realSum, color=room_type, size=person_capacity)) + 
      geom_point(alpha=0.85) + xlab("X") + ylab("Y") + 
      ggtitle("TITLE") + 
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90, vjust=0.5, hjust=1)) +
      ylim(min(input$realSum), max(input$realSum)) +
      xlim(0, 10) +
      theme_classic() +
      scale_color_manual(values =  c("Private room"='coral',
        "Entire home/apt"='lightblue',
        "Shared room"='lightgreen')) +
       guides(color = guide_legend(order = 1), size = guide_legend(order = 2))
  })
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server) 
```


Consider facet graphs for business and vacation rentals; add dataset information and summary stats

write about the different business capacities of different european cities; revenue/growth in tourism population not just for vacationers but for business people as well. 
```{r}
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("TITLE"),
   sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      # Dropdown box for city
    selectInput("city", label = "City:",
              choices= unique(fig_city$city)),
      # Slider range for price
    sliderInput("realSum", label = "Price of Rental", min = 0, 
        max = 1000, value = c(0, 1000)),
      # Checkbox for day of the week
    checkboxGroupInput("dayofweek", label = "Weekday vs. Weekend Rental", 
    choices= unique(fig_city$dayofweek), selected = c("weekday", "weekend")),
      # Checkbox for room type
    checkboxGroupInput("room_type", label = "Rental Room Type", 
    choices= unique(fig_city$room_type), selected = c("Private room", "Entire home/apt", "Shared room"))
    ),
  mainPanel(
     plotOutput("scatterplot")
    )
  ))

server <- function(input, output){
  
   output$scatterplot <- renderPlot({
     
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(dayofweek %in% input$dayofweek)
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(room_type %in% input$room_type)
     newbiz <- c("0" = "Vacation", "1" = "Business")
     
     ggplot(fig_city[fig_city$city==input$city,], aes(x=dist, y=realSum, color=room_type, size=person_capacity)) + 
      geom_point(alpha=0.85) + xlab("X") + ylab("Y") + 
      facet_grid(biz~., labeller = labeller(biz = newbiz)) +
      ggtitle("TITLE") + 
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90, vjust=0.5, hjust=1)) +
      ylim(min(input$realSum), max(input$realSum)) +
      xlim(0, 10) +
      theme_bw() +
      scale_color_manual(values =  c("Private room"='coral',
        "Entire home/apt"='lightblue',
        "Shared room"='lightgreen')) +
       guides(color = guide_legend(order = 1), size = guide_legend(order = 2))
  })
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server) 
```

```{r}
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Question 2: Comparison between Vacation and Business Rentals"),
   sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel( 
     selectInput("city", label = "City:",
              choices= unique(fig_city$city)),
      # Slider range for price
    sliderInput("realSum", label = "Price of Rental", min = 0, 
        max = 1000, value = c(0, 1000)),
      # Checkbox for day of the week
    checkboxGroupInput("dayofweek", label = "Weekday vs. Weekend Rental", 
    choices= unique(fig_city$dayofweek), selected = c("weekday", "weekend")),
      # Checkbox for room type
    checkboxGroupInput("room_type", label = "Rental Room Type", 
    choices= unique(fig_city$room_type), selected = c("Private room", "Entire home/apt", "Shared room"))
  ),
    mainPanel(
      tabsetPanel(
      tabPanel("Scatterplot", plotOutput("scatterplot")),
      tabPanel("Data", dataTableOutput("data_table")),
      tabPanel("Variable Summary", verbatimTextOutput("summary_var")))
  )))

server <- function(input, output){
    
    output$scatterplot <- renderPlot({
     
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(dayofweek %in% input$dayofweek)
     fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(room_type %in% input$room_type)
     newbiz <- c("0" = "Vacation", "1" = "Business")
     
     ggplot(fig_city[fig_city$city==input$city,], aes(x=dist, y=realSum, color=room_type, size=person_capacity)) + 
      geom_point(alpha=0.85) + xlab("Distance from City Center (km)") + ylab("Price of Airbnb (USD)") + 
      facet_grid(biz~., labeller = labeller(biz = newbiz)) +
      ggtitle("Relationship between Airbnb Price, Location, and Purpose of Rental") + 
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle=90, vjust=0.5, hjust=1)) +
      ylim(min(input$realSum), max(input$realSum)) +
      xlim(0, 10) +
      theme_bw() +
      scale_color_manual(values =  c("Private room"='coral',
        "Entire home/apt"='lightblue',
        "Shared room"='lightgreen')) +
       guides(color = guide_legend(order = 1), size = guide_legend(order = 2)) +
       labs(caption = "The figure above demonstrates a trend between Airbnb travel purpose, price, and distance from the 
       city center. Overall, rental price has an inverse relationship with distance: the closer to the city center a 
       property is, the more expensive it often is. Additionally, vacation rentals are more spread out over the 
       metropolitan area, while rentals for business purposes tend to cluster closely around the city center.") +
       theme(plot.caption = element_text(face = "bold"))
  })
    
    output$data_table <- renderDataTable({
      fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(dayofweek %in% input$dayofweek)
      fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(room_type %in% input$room_type)
      fig_city[fig_city$city==input$city,]
    })
    
    output$summary_var <- renderPrint({
      fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(dayofweek %in% input$dayofweek)
      fig_city <- fig_city %>% filter(room_type %in% input$room_type)
      summary(fig_city[fig_city$city==input$city, c("realSum", "person_capacity", "cleanliness_rating", "guest_satisfaction_overall", "bedrooms", "dist", "attr_index")])
    })
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server, options = list(width = 500, height = 500)) 
```
